Political Resident, Persian Gulf. Bahrein, )47. King's Regulation made under Article 83 of the Koweit Order in Council, 1935 No. 1 of 1947 1. No person subject to the Koweit Order in Council shall enter Koweit by land, sea or air unless he is in possession of a passport or other travel document bearing a valid visa for Koweit, according to the practice and instructions from time to time in force. The necessity for the above-mentioned visa may be waived in such cases as the Political Agent mav deem fit. 2. Any person subject to the Koweit Order in Council who, after this Regulation comes into force, enters Koweit in contravention of Article 1 shall be liable to a punishment of imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months or to a fine not exceeding Rs. 500/-, or to both, ^and may be directed to remove himself forthwith or by any date specified or nay be removed from Koweit, and any direction or order for such removal shall be deemed to be an order to which the provisions of Articles 24, 25 and 26 of the Koweit Order in Council, 1935, are applicable. 3. Any person who attempts to commit or abets or attempts to abet the commission of an offence or offences punishable under Article 2 shall be punished in like manner as if he had committed the offence or offences. 4. Any person who has entered Koweit before the date on which this Regulation came into force, without complying with the requirements specified 34909in Article 1 of this Kegulation, and who, on being called upon, does not produce satisfactory evidence that he has visible means of support, shall be liable to be removed from Koweit, and any direction or order for such removal shall be deemed to be an order to which the provisions of Articles 24, 25 and 20 of the Koweit Order in Council are applicable. 5. physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximately chronological order, from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation system in use runs from the front cover to the back cover. The sequence appears written in pencil, enclosed in a circle, in the top right hand corner of the recto page of each folio. A second foliation sequence also appears, again written in pencil, but not enclosed in a circle, in the same area of each folio, numbered 10-12 (ff.2-4).

mods.abstract: The papers consist of a signed copy of a notice of King's Regulations made under Article 83 of the Koweit Order in Council, 1935, Number 1 of 1947('The Koweit Passport Regulation, 1947') dated 25 August 1947, with covering correspondence between the Secretary of State for India and the Political Resident, Persian Gulf, dated August 1947.
